sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
Dioptrica nova, A treatise of dioptricks in two parts : wherein the various effects and appearances of spherick glasses, both convex and concave, single and combined, in telescopes and microscopes, together with their usefulness in many concerns of humane life, are explained / by William Molyneux of Dublin, Esq. ... Molyneux, William, 1656-1698. Halley, Edmond, 1656-1742.
[17], 301, [2] p., 42 folded leaves of plates : ill.
Printed for Benj. Tooke, London : 1692.
Reissued in 1709 with cancel t.p. "Appendix" (p. 295-301) by Edmond Halley. Includes marginal notes. Errata: p. [1] at end. Advertisement: p. [2] at end. Imprimatur page (facing t.p.) contains ms. inscription to 'Christiano Hugenio' (Christiaan Huygens), signed: Gulielmus Molyneux. Reproduction of original in: John Crerar Library.
=======
Dioptrica nova, A treatise of dioptricks in two parts : wherein the various effects and appearances of spherick glasses, both convex and concave, single and combined, in telescopes and microscopes, together with their usefulness in many concerns of humane life, are explained / by William Molyneux of Dublin, Esq. ... Molyneux, William, 1656-1698. Halley, Edmond, 1656-1742.
[17], 301, [2] p., 42 folded leaves of plates : ill.
Printed for Benj. Tooke, London : 1692.
Reissued in 1709 with cancel t.p. "Appendix" (p. 295-301) by Edmond Halley. Includes marginal notes. Errata: p. [1] at end. Advertisement: p. [2] at end. Imprimatur page (facing t.p.) contains ms. inscription to 'Christiano Hugenio' (Christiaan Huygens), signed: Gulielmus Molyneux. Reproduction of original in: John Crerar Library.
Benj. Tooke
